conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the acceleration of the skydiver during the specified interval.

The graph has a vertical axis labeled 'v/(m·s⁻¹)' and a horizontal axis labeled 't/s.' The graph starts at the origin, increases linearly until 10 seconds, then remains constant until 15 seconds, and finally decreases linearly until the end.
The question asks for the direction of acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
From the graph, the velocity increases linearly from 0 to 10 seconds.
Since the velocity is increasing, the acceleration must be positive during this interval.
The graph shows a constant velocity from 10 to 15 seconds, indicating zero acceleration.
After 15 seconds, the velocity decreases, indicating negative acceleration.
Therefore, during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, the acceleration is positive.
The acceleration is positive during the 0 to 10 seconds interval.
